intro: Trophis matudae, commonly known as the Matudae's thornplant, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many toxic and ornamental species. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, spiny leaves, and clusters of small, trumpet-shaped flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of rainforests. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
